intro: Coccochondra laevis, commonly known as the smooth coccochondra, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
